item.title: How To Do Sixties Hair A Step By Step Guide
item.description:
If you're looking to channel your inner Twiggy, Brigitte Bardot, or Mary Quant, then sixties hair is the way to go! This iconic decade was all about big, bold, and beautiful hair, and it's surprisingly easy to recreate this look at home. In this article, we'll take you through a step-by-step guide on how to do sixties hair, including tips, tricks, and a FAQ section to answer all your burning questions. So, grab your hairspray and let's get started!

Description

Sixties hair was all about volume, texture, and drama. Think big bouffants, sleek bobs, and messy updos. This era was all about breaking away from the conservative styles of the past and embracing a more daring and playful look. Sixties hair was often styled with a lot of product, teasing, and backcombing to create the signature height and shape of the era.

How to

Here's how to do sixties hair in six easy steps:

Step 1: Prep your hair

Start by washing your hair and towel-drying it until it's damp. Apply a volumizing mousse or spray to the roots and work it through your hair with your fingers. Blow-dry your hair upside down, using a round brush to add extra volume at the roots.

Step 2: Tease your hair

Take a section of hair at the crown of your head and tease it with a fine-toothed comb. Backcomb the hair towards your scalp in short, quick strokes. Repeat this process with several sections of hair at the crown of your head, working your way towards the front of your hairline.

Step 3: Smooth it out

Once you've teased your hair, gently smooth the top layer with a brush or comb. You want to create a smooth surface on top of the teased hair to make it easier to style.

Step 4: Create your style

There are many different sixties hairstyles to choose from, but one of the most iconic is the bouffant. To create a bouffant, gather the teased hair at the crown of your head and gently lift it upwards. Secure it with bobby pins or a clip. You can also create a sleek bob by using a straightening iron to smooth your hair and tucking the ends under.

Step 5: Add the finishing touches

Once you've created your style, add the finishing touches with hairspray. Spray your hair liberally, focusing on the roots and any flyaways. You can also add a hair accessory like a headband or a hair scarf to complete the look.

Step 6: Enjoy your sixties hair!

Now that you've mastered the art of sixties hair, it's time to rock your new look! Whether you're heading out to a party or just want to add a little retro flair to your everyday style, sixties hair is a fun and easy way to switch things up.

Tips

Here are a few tips to help you get the most out of your sixties hair:

  • Use a fine-toothed comb for teasing and backcombing
  • Don't be afraid to use a lot of hairspray
  • Experiment with different styles, from sleek bobs to messy updos
  • Accessorize with headbands, hair scarves, or vintage hair clips

FAQ

Here are a few frequently asked questions about sixties hair:

Q: Can I do sixties hair on short hair?

A: Absolutely! While some sixties styles work best on longer hair, there are plenty of ways to adapt the look for shorter hair. Try a sleek bob or a messy updo.

Q: Do I need to use a lot of product?

A: Yes, sixties hair was all about big volume and drama, so don't be afraid to use a lot of product. Volumizing mousse, hairspray, and dry shampoo are your friends!

Q: Can I create sixties hair without teasing my hair?

A: Teasing your hair is a key part of creating sixties hair, but if you're not comfortable with it, you can still create a retro look using other techniques like curling or straightening your hair.

Hair Care

Teasing and backcombing can be hard on your hair, so it's important to take care of your hair before and after styling. Use a nourishing shampoo and conditioner to keep your hair healthy and hydrated. You can also use a hair mask once a week to give your hair an extra boost of moisture.

When brushing your hair, use a gentle touch to avoid breaking or damaging your hair. And remember to always use heat protectant spray when using hot tools like curling irons or straightening irons.

By following these tips and taking care of your hair, you can enjoy sixties hair without damaging your locks!

item.title: How To Fix Barbie Hair Easy A Step By Step Guide

If you have children who love playing with Barbie dolls, you might have encountered a common problem: tangled hair. Barbie’s hair can easily become a mess, but don’t worry, there’s a simple solution to fix it. This guide will show you how to fix Barbie hair easy and get your child’s dolls looking brand new again.

Description

Barbie dolls come with long and beautiful hair that can be styled in many ways. However, with frequent play, Barbie’s hair can become tangled, matted, and damaged. This can be frustrating for children and parents alike, but there’s no need to throw away the doll or buy a new one. With a few simple steps, you can easily fix Barbie’s hair and restore it to its original beauty.

How to Fix Barbie Hair Easy: Step-by-Step Guide

Step 1: Gather the Materials

Before you begin, make sure you have all the necessary materials. You will need a comb or a brush, a spray bottle filled with water, a small amount of fabric softener or conditioner, and a towel.

Step 2: Wet the Hair

Start by wetting Barbie’s hair with the spray bottle. Be careful not to soak the doll’s body or clothing. Use your fingers to distribute the water throughout the hair, ensuring that it is evenly damp.

Step 3: Apply Fabric Softener or Conditioner

Apply a small amount of fabric softener or conditioner to Barbie’s hair. This will help to loosen any tangles and make it easier to brush through. Be careful not to use too much, as this can leave the hair greasy or sticky.

Step 4: Comb the Hair

Start at the ends of the hair and work your way up, combing through the tangles gently. Be patient and take your time, as rushing can cause more damage to the hair. If you encounter any stubborn knots, use your fingers to gently pull them apart before using the comb.

Step 5: Rinse the Hair

Rinse the hair with clean water to remove any excess fabric softener or conditioner. Be sure to rinse thoroughly, as leaving any product in the hair can cause it to become sticky or greasy over time.

Step 6: Dry the Hair

Use a towel to gently pat the hair dry. Avoid rubbing, as this can cause the hair to tangle again. Once the hair is mostly dry, use a comb or brush to style it as desired.

Tips for Fixing Barbie Hair

Here are some additional tips to help you fix Barbie hair easy:

  • Use a wide-toothed comb or a brush with soft bristles to avoid damaging the hair.
  • Be gentle and patient when combing through tangles, as pulling too hard can cause the hair to break.
  • Use a small amount of product to avoid leaving the hair greasy or sticky.
  • Encourage your child to take care of their Barbie’s hair by combing it regularly and storing it in a safe place.

FAQ: Frequently Asked Questions

Can I use other products besides fabric softener or conditioner?

Yes, there are other products you can use to fix Barbie hair, such as detangling spray or silicone spray. However, these products can be more expensive and may not be as gentle on the hair as fabric softener or conditioner.

What should I do if the hair is still tangled after following these steps?

If the hair is still tangled, try repeating the steps or using a different product. If the hair is severely damaged or knotted, you may need to trim it or seek professional help.

Hair Care for Barbie Dolls

To keep Barbie’s hair looking its best, it’s important to take care of it properly. Here are some tips for hair care:

  • Store Barbie in a safe place where her hair won’t get tangled or damaged.
  • Regularly comb or brush Barbie’s hair to prevent tangles and knots.
  • Avoid using heat or styling tools on Barbie’s hair, as this can damage it.
  • Clean Barbie’s hair with gentle shampoo and conditioner if it becomes dirty or greasy.

With these tips and steps, you can easily fix Barbie hair easy and keep your child’s dolls looking beautiful for years to come. Happy fixing!

item.title: How To Refresh Curly Hair In The Morning A Complete Guide
item.description:
Are you tired of waking up to a tangled mess of curly hair every morning? Do you dread the thought of having to style your hair from scratch every day? If so, you're not alone. Many women with curly hair struggle with maintaining their curls throughout the day. But don't worry, we've got you covered. In this article, we'll show you how to refresh curly hair in the morning so that you can start your day with beautiful, defined curls.

Why Do Curly Hair Need Refreshing?

Curly hair tends to lose its shape and definition overnight due to friction from pillowcases, hats, and even our own hands. This can leave your curls looking frizzy, flat, and lifeless in the morning. Refreshing your curls in the morning is a quick and easy way to bring them back to life and restore their natural bounce and definition.

How to Refresh Curly Hair in the Morning

Here's a step-by-step guide on how to refresh your curly hair in the morning:

Step 1: Wet Your Hair

Start by wetting your hair with a spray bottle filled with water. Be sure to spray your hair evenly, focusing on the areas that need the most attention.

Step 2: Apply a Leave-In Conditioner

Next, apply a leave-in conditioner to your wet hair. This will help to moisturize your curls and prevent frizz. Be sure to apply the conditioner evenly throughout your hair, focusing on the ends.

Step 3: Scrunch Your Hair

Scrunch your hair with your hands to encourage your curls to reform. Be sure to scrunch gently so that you don't disrupt the curl pattern.

Step 4: Apply a Curl Defining Product

Apply a curl defining product to your hair to help define your curls and prevent frizz. Be sure to apply the product evenly throughout your hair, focusing on the ends.

Step 5: Diffuse Your Hair

Use a diffuser attachment on your hair dryer to dry your hair. Be sure to use a low heat setting to prevent damage to your hair.

Step 6: Finish with a Hair Oil

Finish by applying a hair oil to your ends to help seal in moisture and prevent frizz. Be sure to apply the oil sparingly so that your hair doesn't look greasy.

Tips for Refreshing Curly Hair in the Morning

Here are some additional tips to help you refresh your curly hair in the morning:

  • Use a silk or satin pillowcase to reduce friction and prevent frizz
  • Avoid touching your hair throughout the day to prevent frizz
  • Use a diffuser attachment on your hair dryer to dry your hair without disrupting your curls
  • Apply a curl refreshing spray throughout the day to revive your curls

FAQ

How often should I refresh my curly hair?

It depends on your hair type and lifestyle. Some women refresh their hair every day, while others do it every other day or every few days. Experiment with different routines to find what works best for you.

Can I refresh my curly hair without getting it wet?

Yes, you can use a curl refreshing spray to revive your curls without getting your hair wet. Simply spray the product onto your curls and scrunch with your hands to reform your curls.

What if I don't have a diffuser attachment for my hair dryer?

You can use a t-shirt or microfiber towel to scrunch your hair dry instead. Simply wrap your hair in the towel and scrunch gently to absorb excess moisture.

Hair Care

Remember to take care of your curly hair by using a sulfate-free shampoo and conditioner, deep conditioning once a week, and protecting your hair from heat damage. With the right care and maintenance, you can enjoy beautiful, defined curls every day.

Now that you know how to refresh curly hair in the morning, you can say goodbye to bad hair days and hello to gorgeous, defined curls. Follow these steps, experiment with different products and routines, and find what works best for you. Happy styling!

How to Thin Natural Hair

Thinning natural hair can be done in a variety of ways, from using thinning shears to razor cutting. However, it's important to note that thinning your hair too often or using the wrong tools can lead to damage and breakage. Here are some steps to follow to safely and effectively thin out your natural hair:

Step 1: Wash and Condition Your Hair

Before you begin thinning your natural hair, it's important to start with clean and conditioned hair. This will make it easier to comb and section your hair, and it will also ensure that your hair is healthy and strong enough to handle the thinning process.

Step 2: Comb and Section Your Hair

Once your hair is clean and conditioned, use a wide-tooth comb to detangle your hair. Section your hair into four or more parts, depending on the thickness of your hair. Use hair clips to hold each section in place.

Step 3: Choose Your Thinning Tool

There are several tools that you can use to thin out your natural hair, including thinning shears, razor blades, and texturizing scissors. Choose a tool that you're comfortable using and that will give you the desired results.

Step 4: Thin Out Your Hair

Start at the back of your head and work your way forward. Take a small section of hair, and comb it straight. Use your thinning tool to cut into the section of hair, starting at the mid-lengths and working your way down to the ends. Make sure to only cut a few strands at a time, and avoid cutting too close to the scalp.

Repeat this process on each section of hair, making sure to blend the thinned sections with the un-thinned sections.

Step 5: Style Your Hair

Once you've finished thinning out your natural hair, style your hair as desired. You may notice that your hair feels lighter and has more movement than before.

Tips for Thinning Natural Hair

Thinning natural hair can be a tricky process, but there are several tips that you can follow to make the process easier and more effective:

  • Use a tool that you're comfortable with

  • Blend the thinned sections with the un-thinned sections

Thinning natural hair can cause damage if done too often or using the wrong tools. It's important to use a tool that is specifically designed for thinning hair, and to only thin out a few strands at a time.

Description

Curly hair is characterized by its unique texture and shape. The curl pattern is determined by the shape of the hair follicle, which can be either oval or round. When the hair is healthy, the cuticle layer is smooth and allows the hair to retain moisture, which enhances the curl pattern. However, there are many factors that can cause the hair to lose its curl, including genetics, heat damage, chemical treatments, and environmental factors.

How to Bring Back Your Curls

If you are wondering why your hair isn't curly anymore, there are several things you can do to encourage your natural curl pattern to return. Here are some tips:

Step by Step

Step 1: Take a break from heat styling. Heat styling tools, such as flat irons and curling irons, can damage the hair and cause it to lose its curl. If you must use heat styling tools, be sure to use a heat protectant spray and keep the temperature low.

Step 2: Use a gentle shampoo and conditioner. Harsh shampoos and conditioners can strip the hair of its natural oils, which can make it dry and frizzy. Look for products that are sulfate-free and contain moisturizing ingredients like argan oil or shea butter.

Step 3: Deep condition your hair once a week. Deep conditioning treatments can help to restore moisture to the hair and enhance the curl pattern. Look for a deep conditioner that is specifically formulated for curly hair.

Step 4: Use a diffuser when blow-drying your hair. A diffuser is a tool that attaches to your blow dryer and helps to distribute the heat evenly throughout your hair. This can help to enhance your natural curl pattern and prevent frizz.

Tips

Here are some additional tips for bringing back your curls:

  • Avoid brushing your hair when it is dry, as this can cause frizz.
  • Try using a silk or satin pillowcase, as this can help to prevent tangles and frizz.
  • Avoid using products that contain alcohol, as this can dry out the hair and cause it to lose its curl.
  • If you have chemically treated hair, be sure to use products that are specifically formulated for your hair type.

A: There are many reasons why your hair may have lost its curl, including genetics, heat damage, chemical treatments, and environmental factors.

Q: Can I bring back my curls?

Q: What products should I use to bring back my curls?

A: Look for products that are specifically formulated for curly hair, and that contain moisturizing ingredients like argan oil or shea butter.

Hair Care

Taking good care of your hair is essential for maintaining healthy curls.
